title: Why is ketchup so hard to pour? - George Zaidan

multiple-choice.question: What type of fluid is ketchup classified as?

options.label: A
options.text: Their apparent thickness changes depending on how hard you push

options.label: C
options.text: They can climb up rotating rods

options.label: D
options.text: They get thicker the harder you push

multiple-choice.question: How does ketchup behave when a weak force is applied quickly?

options.label: B
options.text: The particles bump into each other, but can't get out of each other's way, so the ketchup doesn't flow

options.text: It becomes a thousand times thinner

options.label: C

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The particles slowly rearrange themselves into lots of small groups

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of adding natural thickeners like xanthan gum to ketchup?

options.label: D
options.text: It makes the ketchup behave like a Newtonian fluid

multiple-choice.question: What is one way to get ketchup out of the bottle?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Hit the bottle once very, very hard

options.label: C
options.text: Keep the lid on and give the bottle a few short, sharp shakes
